revised_title: Effect of Photoreceptor Coupling and Synapse Nonlinearity on Signal-to-Noise Ratio in Early Visual Processing
tldr: The article investigates the impact of photoreceptor coupling and synapse nonlinearity on the signal-to-noise ratio in early visual processing. The authors demonstrate that receptor coupling can improve the signal-to-noise ratio in bipolar cells, even for localized stimuli, when synapse nonlinearity is considered. This finding suggests a principle of retinal design that may compete with the requirements of high spatial resolution.
